page.title: 07The Churches of Ringmer
page.content:
The{Church of England,}which is part
of the{Anglican}communion, meets in the Parish Church of{St. Mary the {Virgin,}the construction of which dates back to Norman times. The{bell {tower}has eight bells including a tenor weighing 11.5 cwt. and a{ {"peoples' bell"}paid for by the parishioners. This year brought the centenary of the very first peal. The{Roman Catholics}celebrate the "First Mass of Sunday" on Saturday evenings in the Parish Church. There are also three non-conformist churches: the{Free Church}meets in the Village Hall, the{United Reform Church has its own small chapel and the{ {Pentecostal Church}meets in a hut on the Green. All churches meet on certain occasions for United Worship.
